day_1.title: Using data to work together
day_1.text: At the root of data, there is a vision and purpose. The Digital Nations Data 360° Declaration is where members of the Digital Nations recognize and affirm the common data vision and data principles laid out in the Declaration. They agree to work together fostering collaboration, sharing challenges, and identifying areas for active cooperation (where practical and feasible). This vision emphasizes the need for a holistic view of data management.

day_2.title: Personal Identifiable Information (PII) Checking
day_2.text: The Canadian Digital Service has a tool that checks if an application is anonymizing IPs when submitting information to Google Analytics. The tool is implemented as a Google Cloud function.While this tool focuses on IPs, Personal Identifiable Information (PII) is a big part of the digital privacy conversation. When multiple PIIs are obtained by untrusted sources, it could jeopardize your privacy. This tool along with other practices such as encryption secure your information.

day_4.title: The GC Data Community (GCDC)
day_4.text:
If you haven’t heard about the GCDC, you’re about to blown away!As part of the Canada School of Public Service, the GC Data Community provides support in five main areas:

convening and connecting data practitioners from all levels across departments and agencies,

enabling learning and professional development opportunities related to data,

supporting innovation and connections between data communities of practice,

promoting uptake of ethical norms, data standards and governance practices, and

co-hosting the annual Government of Canada Data Conference.

link.title: The GCDC
link.description: The GC Data Community was created to connect, engage and support the growing community of data practitioners across the federal government. It operates based on support from over a dozen departments and agencies.

day_7.text: Charticulator is the no-code way to create custom and reusable chart designs. Now you can create a custom chart right within Power BI using the Microsoft Charticulator Visual, either from scratch or using a template.

day_9.title: Using Teams as a transcription tool
day_9.text: Microsoft Teams has been increasingly becoming more accessible. You can turn on live transcriptions during a meeting, and then download the transcript! Once you’ve gave the document, you can store it, analyze it, upload it and more! Imagine the possibilities!

day_10.title: Find all things data in the GC!
day_10.text: The Data Ecosystem Resource Directory is a handy catalogue of data resources put together by and for GC data practitioners. Browse through the directory to find everything about data in the GC, from a list of active communities to directives and guidelines that could help you with your day-to-day work.

day_11.title: Data Podcast
day_11.text: Listen to Kaveh Afshar discuss his experience working in the Chief Data Office at Environment and Climate Change Canada, and how that team worked towards solving data problems for others through computer science, statistics and math knowledge.

day_12.title: Free coding app for beginners
day_12.text: With Grasshopper, a free coding app for beginners, you can easily learn and understand coding without any previous experience. In as little as five minutes a day, you can complete lessons, quizzes and visual puzzles to build your coding skills. Move through progressively challenging levels as you develop your abilities, then graduate with fundamental programming skills for your next step as a coder.

link.title: Learn to Code for Free – Grasshopper
link.description: Grasshopper is the coding app for beginners. With fun, quick lessons on your phone, the app teaches adult learners to write real JavaScript.
